message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

This paper deals with the problem of guarding art galleries efficiently, which is a classic problem in computational geometry falling under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also discusses the VC-dimension, which is a concept from machine learning and falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper uses combinatorial arguments to prove the upper bound on the number of points that can be shattered, which is a technique commonly used in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the concept of polygons and their properties, which is a topic in computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper discusses the algorithmic aspect of the problem, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT).
